oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-11-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 18, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Ford Rush, and Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Ford Rush; Jack Shook; Missouri Mountaineers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Bully Of The Town (George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers) -- Announcer closing statement -- Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Late Last Night When My Willie Came Home (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- Memories (Ford Rush, Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers -- Up Jumped The Devil (Jack Shook and the Missouri Mountaineers) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- Keep My Skillet Good And Greasy (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Old Age Pension Check (Roy Acuff) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Shook, Jack; Missouri Mountaineers (Musical group)
